file_content.text: Long ago, you sought to free us from Belsavis prison.
Since then you have grown. In mind and body; in skill and in spirit.
Meanwhile, we have tasted death. On Darvannis, you ripped Lord Styrak from our union.
Meanwhile, we have tasted death. On Darvannis, the Empire slew Lord Styrak and ripped him from our union.
From our wound bleeds our memories; our names; our ambitions. We tasted oblivion, and it drowns us. Like you, we are changing.
Talk to me, Dread Masters. Why are we here? Why are you telling me this?
What is it that you want?
I understand. You're in pain. If we work together, it doesn't have to last.
Maybe I can help you.
Poor Masters. Do you miss your brother? Come face me, and I'll reunite you.
You're not impressing me.
You do not comprehend.
Once, we desired an empire. Now, with the death of Lord Styrak, we are going mad.
The wound must be healed. Our union requires a sixth--or there will be only chaos.
You have ruined worlds together. Alone, your deeds are legendary, and legions tremble at your names.
One of you may possess strength enough to join us. Your mortal dreams will be our feast, and our union will grow strong.
You were the Emperor's Wrath; you drove a Jedi to the brink of madness and strike terror into the hearts of millions.
Soon you will join us as our Scion of Terror. We will feast on your dreams, and our union shall be strong again.
You turned on the Emperor and the Empire. You are not worthy of my allegiance.
I don't join traitors.
You of all Sith know power and darkness and secret terror. Once a wretched slave, you became a being worthy of worship.
Now you will join us and we will feast upon your dreams as we grow strong together.
You can promise power--but I will never be a slave again. And you cannot defy me forever.
You want to control me.
You will not deny the truth when you have been humbled, stripped of all but fear.
You walk in darkness, spreading fear by whispers. You learned the power of Lord Jadus, who sees much that we see.
You stalk your prey, using terror as well as weapons. How many of your victims ran at the sound of your name?
You are not Sith, but you may join us, serve us as Kephess did. We will feast upon your mortal dreams, and our union will be strong again.
You brainwash your servants. I know how that works--and you don't want to try it on me.
No one controls me again.
Your resistance cannot last.
I'll make it simple: You want a bounty hunter, you offer to pay. But I doubt you have enough.
That's a pretty weak deal.
This is my offer to you: Open your fortress and accept that you've lost. Your lives will be spared.
One chance: Surrender.
Pointless words.
If I were to say yes--if I were to accept a part in your "union"--how would we begin?
Let's suppose I did join you.
You must first be degraded. You must be humbled and humiliated, stripped of all but fear.
Even now, our ships prepare to launch and deliver our devices to other worlds--Dromund Kaas, Nar Shaddaa, and Coruscant.
Populations will be infected and planets overgrown. Mothers will kill daughters as soldiers weep in terror.
All you love and prize will fall. You will try to stop our ships and fail. Then you will be ready to join us.
Long ago, we learned of your abilities in the Belsavis prison.
